h1.definition: a primitive word; father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application; chief, (fore-) father(-less), × patrimony, principal. Compare names in 'Abi-'.

h3.definition: from the same as {{h24}}; a green plant; greenness, fruit.

h5.definition: of foreign origin; Abagtha, a eunuch of Xerxes; Abagtha.

h6.definition: a primitive root; properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy); break, destroy(-uction),   not escape, fail, lose, (cause to, make) perish, spend, × and surely, take, be undone, × utterly, be void of, have no way to flee.

h8.definition: active of participle of {{h6}}; (concrete) wretched or (abstract) destruction; perish.

h9.definition: from {{h6}}; Compare {{h10}}.; concrete, something lost; abstract, destruction, i.e. Hades; lost.

h10.definition: the same as {{h9}}, miswritten for {{h11}}; a perishing; destruction.

h11.definition: intensive from {{h6}}; abstract, a perishing; concrete, Hades; destruction.

h14.definition: a primitive root; to breathe after, i.e. (figuratively) to be acquiescent; consent, rest content will, be willing.

h16.definition: from {{h14}} (in the sense of bending toward); the papyrus; swift.

h17.definition: from {{h14}} (in the sense of desiring); want; sorrow.

h18.definition: from {{h75}}; a manger or stall; crib.

h19.definition: from an unused root (apparently meaning to turn); brandishing of a sword; point.

h20.definition: of uncertain derivation; a melon (only plural); melon.

h21.definition: from {{h1}}; fatherly; Abi, Hezekiah's mother; Abi.

h22.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h410}}; father (i.e. possessor) of God; Abiel, the name of two Israelites; Abiel.

h23.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h622}}; father of gathering (i.e. gatherer); Abiasaph, an Israelite; Abiasaph.

h24.definition: from an unused root (meaning to be tender); green, i.e. a young ear of grain; hence, the name of the month Abib or Nisan; Abib, ear, green ears of corn (not maize).

h25.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h1391}}; father (i.e. founder) of Gibon; Abi-Gibon, perhaps an Israelite; father of Gibeon.

h26.definition: or shorter אֲבִיגַל; from {{h1}} and {{h1524}}; father (i.e. source) of joy; Abigail or Abigal, the name of two Israelitesses; Abigal.

h27.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h1777}}; father of judgment (i.e. judge); Abidan, an Israelite; Abidan.

h28.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h3045}}; father of knowledge (i.e. knowing); Abida, a son of Abraham by Keturah; Abida, Abidah.

h29.definition: or prolonged אֲבִיָּהוּ ; from {{h1}} and {{h3050}}; father (i.e. worshipper) of Jah; Abijah, the name of several Israelite men and two Israelitesses; Abiah, Abijah.

h30.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h1931}}; father (i.e. worshipper) of Him (i.e. God); Abihu, a son of Aaron; Abihu.

h31.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h1935}}; father (i.e. possessor) of renown; Abihud, the name of two Israelites; Abihud.

h32.definition: or (more correctly) אֲבִיחַיִל ; from {{h1}} and {{h2428}}; father (i.e. possessor) of might; Abihail or Abichail, the name of three Israelites and two Israelitesses; Abihail.

h33.definition: from {{h44}} with the article inserted; father of the Ezrite; an Abiezrite or descendant of Abiezer; Abiezrite.

h34.definition: from {{h14}}, in the sense of want (especially in feeling); destitute; beggar, needy, poor (man).

h35.definition: from {{h14}}; provocative of desire; the caper berry (from its stimulative taste); desire.

h36.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h2898}}; father of goodness (i.e. good); Abitub, an Israelite; Abitub.

h37.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h2919}}; father of dew (i.e. fresh); Abital, a wife of King David; Abital.

h38.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h3220}}; father of (the) sea (i.e. seaman); Abijam (or Abijah), a king of Judah; Abijam.

h39.definition: from {{h1}} and an elsewhere unused (probably foreign) word; father of Mael (apparently some Arab tribe); Abimael, a son of Joktan; Abimael.

h40.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h4428}}; father of (the) king; Abimelek, the name of two Philistine kings and of two Israelites; Abimelech.

h41.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h5068}}; father of generosity (i.e. liberal); Abinadab, the name of four Israelites; Abinadab.

h42.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h5278}}; father of pleasantness (i.e. gracious); Abinoam, an Israelite; Abinoam.

h43.definition: contracted from {{h23}}; Ebjasaph, an Israelite; Ebiasaph.

h44.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h5829}}; father of help (i.e. helpful); Abiezer, the name of two Israelites; Abiezer.

h45.definition: from {{h1}} and an unused root of uncertain derivation; probably, father of strength (i.e. valiant); Abialbon, an Israelite; Abialbon.

h47.definition: for {{h46}}; angel, bull, chiefest, mighty (one), stout(-hearted), strong (one), valiant.

h48.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h7311}}; father of height (i.e. lofty); Abiram, the name of two Israelites; Abiram.

h49.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h7686}}; father of error (i.e. blundering); Abishag, a concubine of David; Abishag.

h50.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h7771}}; father of plenty (i.e. prosperous); Abishua, the name of two Israelites; Abishua.

h51.definition: from {{h1}} and {{h7791}}; father of (the) wall (i.e. perhaps mason); Abishur, an Israelite; Abishur.

h52.definition: or (shorter) אַבְשַׁי ; from {{h1}} and {{h7862}}; father of a gift (i.e. probably generous); Abishai, an Israelite; Abishai.

h53.definition: or (shortened) אַבְשָׁלוֹם ; from {{h1}} and {{h7965}}; father of peace (i.e. friendly); Abshalom, a son of David; also (the fuller form) a later Israelite; Abishalom, Absalom.

h54.definition: contracted from {{h1}} and {{h3498}}; father of abundance (i.e. liberal); Ebjathar, an Israelite; Abiathar.

h55.definition: a primitive root; probably to coil upward; mount up.

h56.definition: a primitive root; to bewail; lament, mourn.

h58.definition: from an unused root (meaning to be grassy); a meadow; plain. Compare also the proper names beginning with Abel-.

h59.definition: from {{h58}}; a meadow; Abel, the name of two places in Palestine.; Abel.

h61.definition: apparently from {{h56}} through the idea of negation; nay, i.e. truly or yet; but, indeed, nevertheless, verily.

h62.definition: from {{h58}} and {{h1004}} and {{h4601}}; meadow of Beth-Maakah; Abel of Beth-maakah, a place in Palestine; Abel-beth-maachah, Abel of Beth-maachah,

h63.definition: from {{h58}} and the plural of {{h7848}}, with the article inserted; meadow of the acacias; Abel hash-Shittim, a place in Palestine; Abelshittim.

h64.definition: from {{h58}} and the plural of {{h3754}}; meadow of vineyards; Abel-Keramim, a place in Palestine; plain of the vineyards.

h65.definition: from {{h58}} and {{h4246}}; meadow of dancing; Abel-Mecholah, a place in Palestine; Abel-meholah.

h66.definition: from {{h58}} and {{h4325}}; meadow of water; Abel-Majim, a place in Palestine; Abel-maim.

h67.definition: from {{h58}} and {{h4714}}; meadow of Egypt; Abel-Mitsrajim, a place in Palestine; Abel-mizraim.

h68.definition: from the root of {{h1129}} through the meaning to build; a stone; carbuncle,   mason,   plummet, (chalk-, hail-, head-, sling-) stone(-ny), (divers) weight(-s).

h70.definition: from the same as {{h68}}; a pair of stones (only dual); a potter's wheel or a midwife's stool (consisting alike of two horizontal disks with a support between); wheel, stool.

h71.definition: perhaps feminine of {{h68}}; stony;	Compare {{h549}}.; Abanah, a river near Damascus; Abana.

h72.definition: from {{h68}} and {{h5828}} with the article inserted; stone of the help; Eben-ha-Ezer, a place in Palestine; Ebenezer.

h73.definition: of uncertain derivation; a belt; girdle.

h74.definition: or (fully) אֲבִינֵר ; from {{h1}} and {{h5216}}; father of light (i.e. enlightening); Abner, an Israelite; Abner.

h75.definition: a primitive root; to fodder; fatted, stalled.

h76.definition: (by reduplication) from an unused root (meaning to belch forth); an inflammatory pustule (as eruption); blains.

h77.definition: from an unused root probably meaning to gleam; conspicuous; Ebets, a place in Palestine; Abez.

h78.definition: from the same as {{h76}}; splendid; Ibtsan, an Israelite; Ibzan.

h79.definition: a primitive root, probably to float away (as vapor), but used only as denominative from {{h80}}; to bedust, i.e. grapple; wrestle.

h80.definition: from root of {{h79}}; light particles (as volatile); (small) dust, powder.

h82.definition: a primitive root; to soar; fly.

h85.definition: contracted from {{h1}} and an unused root (probably meaning to be populous); father of a multitude; Abraham, the later name of Abram; Abraham.

h86.definition: probably an Egyptian word meaning; kneel; bow the knee.

h87.definition: contracted from {{h48}}; high father; Abram, the original name of Abraham; Abram.

h88.definition: plural of {{h178}}; water-skins; Oboth, a place in the Desert; Oboth.

h89.definition: of uncertain derivation (compare {{h90}}); Age, an Israelite; Agee.

h90.definition: or אֲגָג; of uncertain derivation (compare {{h89}}); flame; Agag, a title of Amalekitish kings; Agag.

h91.definition: patrial or patronymic from {{h90}}; an Agagite or descendent (subject) of Agag; Agagite.

h92.definition: feminine passive participle of an unused root (meaning to bind); a band, bundle, knot, or arch; bunch, burden, troop.

h93.definition: prob of Persian origin; a nut; nut.

h94.definition: passive participle of {{h103}}; gathered (i.e. received among the sages); Agur, a fanciful name for Solomon; Agur.

h95.definition: from the same as {{h94}}; properly, something gathered, i.e. perhaps a grain or berry; used only of a small (silver) coin; piece (of) silver.

h96.definition: from an unused root (meaning to flow down or together as drops); a reservoir; drop.

h97.definition: dual of {{h96}}.; a double pond; Eglajim, a place in Moab; Eglaim.

h98.definition: from an unused root (meaning to collect as water); a marsh; hence a rush (as growing in swamps); hence a stockade of reeds; pond, pool, standing (water).

h99.definition: probably from the same as {{h98}} (in the sense of stagnant water); figuratively, sad; pond.

h100.definition: from the same as {{h98}}; a marshy pool (others from a different root, a kettle); by implication; a rush (as growing there); collectively a rope of rushes; bulrush, caldron, hook, rush.
